data.name: DeFi Basics
data.text: DeFi is a term used to describe financial applications that are built on blockchain technology. These applications are decentralized, meaning they operate on a peer-to-peer basis, and are not controlled by any central authority. DeFi allows users to access financial services in a more transparent, efficient, and secure manner.

questions.text: What is the benefit of using DeFi applications?
What is the main characteristic of DeFi applications?

data.name: Risks and Rewards
data.text: While DeFi can offer many benefits, it is important to understand the risks involved. DeFi is a relatively new and untested technology, which means that there is a higher level of risk involved. Additionally, since DeFi is decentralized, there is no central authority to provide oversight or insurance.

questions.text: What is one risk of using DeFi applications?
Why is there no central authority to provide oversight or insurance in DeFi?

answers.text: No, it is relatively new and untested
